medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 1 day ago with an episode after eating rice cake pudding last night at 9 pm, characterized by persistent epigastric pain with radiation to the left upper quadrant (LUQ). Previously, he had about three episodes over the past 6 months, typically lasting about an hour, which subsided after the pain attributed to the gallbladder.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. LFT abnormalities 2. Cholelithiasis 3. Hypertension (HTN) 4. Persistent hypokalemia 5. H. pylori (treated twice)
medical_history.family_history: Father has renal failure, IgA nephropathy, hypertension, colon cancer, thyroid cancer, coronary artery disease. Mother has hypertension.
